net.iso2013.peapi.api.listener

Interface Listener


  • public interface Listener
    Since:
    2018-02-16
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    iso2013

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Listener.ListenerPriority 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Listener.ListenerPriority getPriority()
      Gets the priority that this listener should run at.
      org.bukkit.entity.EntityType[] getTargets()
      Gets the targets that this listener is fired for.
      void onEvent(EntityPacketEvent e)
      This method is invoked by the event dispatcher whenever a packet event fires.
      default boolean requiresCollidable()
      Whether or not this listener should be fired for custom collision events caused by custom hitboxes in fake entities.
      default boolean shouldFireForFake()
      Gets whether or not to fire this listener for fake packet-based entities.

    • Method Detail

      • getPriority

        Listener.ListenerPriority getPriority()
        Gets the priority that this listener should run at. Higher priority listeners are run LAST, to ensure that their changes take effect.
        Returns:
        the priority of this listener

      • onEvent

        void onEvent(EntityPacketEvent e)
        This method is invoked by the event dispatcher whenever a packet event fires.
        Parameters:
        e - the event

      • shouldFireForFake

        default boolean shouldFireForFake()
        Gets whether or not to fire this listener for fake packet-based entities. By default, this returns false.
        Other listeners can set this to true for their listeners, so you can not assume that just because this returns false, all events fired are for real entities.
        Returns:
        if it should be fired for fake entities

      • getTargets

        org.bukkit.entity.EntityType[] getTargets()
        Gets the targets that this listener is fired for. This is only used to check if this listener needs to listen to objects or to entities. You can not assume that this listener will be fired only for your type because this only contains your type; if it contains an entity it will be fired for all entities, and if it contains an object, it will be fired for all objects.
        Returns:
        the array containing the list of targets that this listener needs to fire for.

      • requiresCollidable

        default boolean requiresCollidable()
        Whether or not this listener should be fired for custom collision events caused by custom hitboxes in fake entities.
        Returns:
        whether or not this should be fired for fake collision boxes
